p: Development of a national strategy for hepatitis B elimination must incorporate national sustainable financing solutions. Most global donors, including The Global Fund ( 45) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation(46), currently do not fund hepatitis B activities other than on a small scale for persons co-infected with HIV, and this policy is unlikely to change in the near future. Incorporating elimination programmes into UHC and ensuring hepatitis B diagnostics and medications are on national essential medicines lists helps offset costs. Investment in maternal-child health programmes by global donors may also represent avenues to deliver improved birth dose vaccine delivery through increased antenatal care coverage and skilled health-worker birth attendance(43).
